justification: org.apache.commons.lang3.time has Ce=4 and Ca=1 -> stability I = 1/(1+4) = 0.20 (unstable). Its outgoing dependencies have higher stability: org.apache.commons.lang3.function I = 7/(7+2) = 0.78, org.apache.commons.lang3 I = 13/(13+10) = 0.565, org.apache.commons.lang3.exception I = 5/(5+1) = 0.83, org.apache.commons.lang3.math I = 3/(3+1) = 0.75. All outgoing dependencies are more stable than org.apache.commons.lang3.time, so the Stable Dependencies Principle is respected and there is no Unstable Dependency smell.

Analyzed package org.apache.commons.lang3.stream has Ce=2, Ca=2 -> instability I = 2/(2+2) = 0.50. Its outgoing dependencies are: org.apache.commons.lang3.function (Ce=2, Ca=7 -> I = 2/(2+7) ≈ 0.22) and org.apache.commons.lang3 (Ce=10, Ca=13 -> I = 10/(10+13) ≈ 0.43). Both outgoing dependencies have lower instability than the analyzed package (they are more stable), so the package does not depend on less stable components. Incoming dependencies (org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect Ce=5, Ca=1 -> I ≈ 0.83; org.apache.commons.lang3 I ≈ 0.43) do not change this assessment. Therefore no Unstable Dependency smell is detected.

Analyzed package metrics: Ce=2, Ca=0 -> instability I = Ce/(Ca+Ce) = 2/(0+2) = 1.0 (very unstable). Outgoing dependencies: 1) org.apache.commons.lang3.function: Ce=2, Ca=7 -> I = 2/(7+2) = 0.222; 2) org.apache.commons.lang3: Ce=10, Ca=13 -> I = 10/(13+10) = 0.435. Both outgoing dependencies have lower instability (are more stable) than the analyzed package. Incoming dependencies: none (Ca=0). Because the package depends only on more stable packages (lower I values), the Unstable Dependency smell is not detected.

org.apache.commons.lang3.function has Ca=7 and Ce=2 (stability = 7/(7+2) = 0.778). It depends on org.apache.commons.lang3.exception (Ca=5, Ce=1, stability = 0.833) and org.apache.commons.lang3 (Ca=13, Ce=10, stability = 0.565). Because org.apache.commons.lang3.function depends on org.apache.commons.lang3 whose stability (0.565) is lower than the analyzed package (0.778), the Stable Dependencies Principle is violated (depends on a less stable package).

Analyzed package metrics: Ce=1, Ca=0 (stability I = 0/(0+1) = 0). Outgoing dependency: org.apache.commons.lang3 (Ce=10, Ca=13, stability I = 13/(13+10) ≈ 0.565). Incoming dependencies: none. Because org.apache.commons.lang3.util depends only on org.apache.commons.lang3 which is more stable (higher stability index) than org.apache.commons.lang3.util, the Stable Dependencies Principle is not violated and there is no Unstable Dependency smell.

Analyzed package has Ce=1 and Ca=1 (Instability I = 1/(1+1) = 0.5). Its single outgoing dependency is org.apache.commons.lang3 (Ce=10, Ca=13, I = 13/(13+10) ≈ 0.565), which is slightly more stable than the analyzed package. Because the analyzed package depends only on a more stable package, it does not depend on a less stable component, so the Unstable Dependency smell is not present for this package. (Note: there is a mutual dependency — org.apache.commons.lang3 also depends on this package — which means a more stable package depends on a less stable one, but that is a violation relative to org.apache.commons.lang3 rather than this analyzed package.)

org.apache.commons.lang3.builder has Ca=1, Ce=3 => stability I = 1/(1+3) = 0.25. It has outgoing dependencies to: org.apache.commons.lang3 (Ca=13, Ce=10 => I = 13/23 ≈ 0.565), org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect (Ca=1, Ce=5 => I = 1/6 ≈ 0.1667), and org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple (Ca=1, Ce=1 => I = 0.5). Because it depends on org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect which is less stable (I ≈ 0.1667) than org.apache.commons.lang3.builder (I = 0.25), the Stable Dependencies Principle is violated (package depends on a less stable package) -> Unstable Dependency detected.

Analyzed package has Ce=2 and Ca=0 (stability I=0.000). Its outgoing dependencies are org.apache.commons.lang3.function (Ca=7, Ce=2, I≈0.778) and org.apache.commons.lang3.exception (Ca=5, Ce=1, I≈0.833). Both dependencies are more stable than the analyzed package (0.778 and 0.833 > 0.000), so the package does not depend on less stable components and no Unstable Dependency smell is detected.

The package has Ce=0 (no outgoing/efferent dependencies) and Ca=1 (one incoming), giving instability I = 0/(0+1) = 0 (fully stable). There are no outgoing dependencies to less-stable packages; the only relation is an incoming dependency from org.apache.commons.lang3. Therefore the Stable Dependencies Principle is not violated and Unstable Dependency is not detected.

org.apache.commons.lang3.compare has Ce=0 (no outgoing dependencies) and Ca=1, giving stability I=1.0. It does not depend on any other packages, so it cannot depend on less-stable packages. The only incoming dependency is from org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect (Ce=5, Ca=1, I≈0.1667), which depends on this package — that is the correct direction (less stable package depending on more stable one). Therefore no Unstable Dependency is detected for org.apache.commons.lang3.compare.

org.apache.commons.lang3.mutable has Ce=1 and Ca=3 (stability I = 3/(3+1) = 0.75). It has an outgoing dependency to org.apache.commons.lang3 which has Ce=10 and Ca=13 (stability I = 13/(13+10) ≈ 0.565). Because org.apache.commons.lang3.mutable depends on org.apache.commons.lang3 whose stability (≈0.565) is lower than its own (0.75), this violates the Stable Dependencies Principle and indicates an Unstable Dependency smell.

org.apache.commons.lang3.math has Ce=1 and Ca=3 (instability I = 3/(3+1) = 0.75), and its sole outgoing dependency is org.apache.commons.lang3 which has Ce=10 and Ca=13 (instability I = 13/(13+10) ≈ 0.565). Because org.apache.commons.lang3.math is more stable (higher I) yet depends on a less stable package (lower I), this violates the Stable Dependencies Principle and constitutes an Unstable Dependency. The dependency relationship is explicit in the outgoing dependencies (depends on org.apache.commons.lang3). Incoming dependencies (org.apache.commons.lang3.time and org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect) further show usage by relatively unstable packages, but the primary smell is that the analyzed package depends on a less stable package (org.apache.commons.lang3).

Analyzed package metrics Ce=2, Ca=1 -> stability I = 1/(1+2) = 0.333. Outgoing dependencies: org.apache.commons.lang3.mutable (Ce=1, Ca=3 -> I = 3/4 = 0.75) and org.apache.commons.lang3 (Ce=10, Ca=13 -> I = 13/23 ≈ 0.565). Both outgoing dependency packages have higher stability than org.apache.commons.lang3.text (0.75 and ~0.565 > 0.333), so the package does not depend on less stable packages. Therefore, no Unstable Dependency smell detected.

org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect has Ce=5 and Ca=1, instability I = 1/(1+5) = 0.1667. All outgoing dependencies point to packages with higher stability (I greater than 0.1667): org.apache.commons.lang3.mutable (Ce=1,Ca=3 -> I=0.75), org.apache.commons.lang3 (Ce=10,Ca=13 -> I≈0.565), org.apache.commons.lang3.stream (Ce=2,Ca=2 -> I=0.5), org.apache.commons.lang3.compare (Ce=0,Ca=1 -> I=1.0), org.apache.commons.lang3.math (Ce=1,Ca=3 -> I=0.75). The incoming dependency org.apache.commons.lang3.builder (Ce=3,Ca=1 -> I=0.25) is also more stable than the analyzed package. Because all dependencies of the package go to more stable packages, the Unstable Dependency smell is not present.

org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple has Ce=1 and Ca=1 (instability I = 1/(1+1) = 0.50). Its only outgoing dependency is org.apache.commons.lang3.function which has Ce=2 and Ca=7 (I = 2/(2+7) ≈ 0.22), so tuple depends on a more stable package — this follows the Stable Dependencies Principle. Incoming dependency org.apache.commons.lang3.builder (Ce=3, Ca=1, I=0.75) depends on tuple, but incoming unstable dependents do not make tuple violate the principle. Therefore no Unstable Dependency is detected.

org.apache.commons.lang3.exception has Ce=1 and Ca=5 -> stability = 5/(5+1) = 0.8333. Analyzed package org.apache.commons.lang3 has Ce=10, Ca=13 -> stability I = 13/(13+10) = 0.565. Outgoing dependencies and their stability: org.apache.commons.lang3.function (Ca=7, Ce=2, I=0.778), org.apache.commons.lang3.mutable (Ca=3, Ce=1, I=0.750), org.apache.commons.lang3.exception (Ca=5, Ce=1, I=0.833), org.apache.commons.lang3.text (Ca=1, Ce=2, I=0.333), org.apache.commons.lang3.stream (Ca=2, Ce=2, I=0.500), org.apache.commons.lang3.time (Ca=1, Ce=4, I=0.200), org.apache.commons.lang3.arch (Ca=1, Ce=0, I=1.000), org.apache.commons.lang3.text.translate (Ca=1, Ce=1, I=0.500), org.apache.commons.lang3.builder (Ca=1, Ce=3, I=0.250), org.apache.commons.lang3.math (Ca=3, Ce=1, I=0.750).
